data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word لِلَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to provide, supply, bestow, grant. turzaqan - you both shall be supplied. rizq - bounty, gift. raziq - one who provides or supplies. razzaq -great provider/supplier.
data.sentence: The word رِزْقًا comes from the root ر ز ق and is associated with the meanings: to provide, supply, bestow, grant. turzaqan - you both shall be supplied. rizq - bounty, gift. raziq - one who provides or supplies. razzaq -great provider/supplier.

data.meanings: to be right/good/honest/upright/sound/righteous, suit, fit. aslaha - to set a thing aright, reform, do good. saalihaat - good works, fit and suiting deeds. aslaha (vb. 4) - to make whole sound, set things right, effect an agreement between, render fit. islaah - uprightness, reconciliation, amendment, reformation. muslihun - reformer, one who is upright, righteous, a person of integrity, peacemaker, suitable.saalih - name of a prophet sent to the tribe of Thamuud.
data.sentence: The word صَالِحًا comes from the root ص ل ح and is associated with the meanings: to be right/good/honest/upright/sound/righteous, suit, fit. aslaha - to set a thing aright, reform, do good. saalihaat - good works, fit and suiting deeds. aslaha (vb. 4) - to make whole sound, set things right, effect an agreement between, render fit. islaah - uprightness, reconciliation, amendment, reformation. muslihun - reformer, one who is upright, righteous, a person of integrity, peacemaker, suitable.saalih - name of a prophet sent to the tribe of Thamuud.

data.meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.
data.sentence: The word وَرَسُولِهِ comes from the root ر س ل and is associated with the meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.

data.meanings: To be productive, generous, precious, valuable, honourable, noble, All-Generous, Most Generous
data.sentence: The word كَرِيمًا comes from the root ك ر م and is associated with the meanings: To be productive, generous, precious, valuable, honourable, noble, All-Generous, Most Generous

data.meanings: to be ready, prepared, at hand, provide a thing for the future.
data.sentence: The word وَأَعْتَدْنَا comes from the root ع ت د and is associated with the meanings: to be ready, prepared, at hand, provide a thing for the future.

data.meanings: To pass or pass by or pass beyond, proceed, go along or go through or go over, go away or pass away, to run or flow (namely water), go across a thing, come upon, overcome, make a thing bitter or displeasing, to drag a thing along, to twist or turn a thing in an attempt to throw it down, to go on in a continuous/constant manner or course, to be firm/resolute/determined/strong, firmly resist a thing, to murmur or grumble, to shake or quiver or quake, move to and fro or from side to side, to be in a state of commotion, overcome by bile.
data.sentence: The word مَرَّتَيْنِ comes from the root م ر ر and is associated with the meanings: To pass or pass by or pass beyond, proceed, go along or go through or go over, go away or pass away, to run or flow (namely water), go across a thing, come upon, overcome, make a thing bitter or displeasing, to drag a thing along, to twist or turn a thing in an attempt to throw it down, to go on in a continuous/constant manner or course, to be firm/resolute/determined/strong, firmly resist a thing, to murmur or grumble, to shake or quiver or quake, move to and fro or from side to side, to be in a state of commotion, overcome by bile.

data.meanings: to be devout, obedient, fully and wholeheartedly in all humility to stand long in prayer. qanitun - one who is fully, wholehearted and in all humility devout and obedient.
data.sentence: The word يَقْنُتْ comes from the root ق ن ت and is associated with the meanings: to be devout, obedient, fully and wholeheartedly in all humility to stand long in prayer. qanitun - one who is fully, wholehearted and in all humility devout and obedient.

data.meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.
data.sentence: The word وَتَعْمَلْ comes from the root ع م ل and is associated with the meanings: to do/make/act/work/operate/perform/construct/manufacture, practice a handcraft, be active, one who does.

data.meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
data.sentence: The word نُؤْتِهَا comes from the root ا ت ي and is associated with the meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
The word أَجْرَهَا comes from the root ا ج ر and is associated with the meanings: recompense/compensation/reward, hire/pay/wage for service, profit
